name: european soaps
description:
Oliveraie Collection by Pre de Provence from France

Yummy rich lotion, pump hand soap, the richest body butter around and cute little blocks of soap a la Marseille tradition. 

Heading into summer our skin becomes super thirsty so this gives is a long, cool drink. And it doesn’t smell too perfumey so it’s guy friendly too. Made from olives harvested in Provence (wow….so fancy!), and no the beautiful packaging with Van Gogh paintings didn’t sway us in the least. (nudge nudge, wink wink)

name: verbena botanicals organics
description:
an all natural, hand-crafted line of pure goodness. made by a lovely lady in oregon we met at gift show. lovely packaging, high-quality ingredients and crafted with great care. it is a great addition to our little shop

goats milk soaps in muslin bags
mini bath salts 
intensive heat balm (safe, therapeutic warming cream)
pump lotions in glass jar! (coconut milk and honey) 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------


"We use recycled, reclaimed, and sustainable materials for our packaging with few exceptions. All our products are made in our Hillsboro, Oregon Shop. For each product that we decide to make, we do extensive research on all of the ingredients as well as any materials that we may be using for packaging."

name: bookshelf: crafty
description: current favorite the of craft and creativity type. we love, use and like to keep these in the shop.

name: bookshelf: book group favorites
description: we're big readers around here. love, love stacks of books lying around (in fact kim's interior design style is a la stacks of books). head here periodically for current favorite reads on our bookshelf: fiction, non-fiction, crafts, kids, cookbooks, book club picks... if it's currently a favorite we'll post it up here. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- in the mood to browse stacks and stacks, need ebooks or audio books? head over to our full service bookshop site: maisieblue's books & more

options.name: while we were watching downton abbey

name: bookshelf: cookery
description: Cookbooks are a weakness, we admit. Here's where you'll find our current favorites and a few classic stand-bys that are in constant rotation in our kitchens.

options.name: artisan bread in 5 minutes a day

name: berroco maya
description:
A chainette yarn blend of silky Pima cotton with just a touch of soft baby alpaca. In a palette reminiscent of natural plant dyed hues

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hank Weight: 
50g – 1.75 oz

Hank Length:
137yds – 125m

Knitting Gauge:
5 sts = 1"
20 sts & 28 rows = 4" (10cm)

Needle Size:
8 (US) / 5 mm

Crochet Gauge:
4 sc = 1"
16 sc & 21 rows = 4" (10cm)

Hook Size:
8(H) (US) / 5 mm

Yarn Fiber: 
85% Cotton / 15% Alpaca

Yarn Wash Info: 
Machine wash in sweater bag, cold water, delicate cycle. Lay flat to dry.

name: berroco weekend yarns
description:
Berroco Weekend is the perfect yarn for any laidback knitting project. A soft, comfortable machine washable blend, this yarn is uncomplicated from start to finish.

Available in three weights: DK, Worsted and Chunky 

Huge color range too! Perfect work-horse yarn for three-seasons knitting and wearing. A great staple, kid-friendly yarn. It works up with a soft, cottony-hand that wears well and won't break the bank. 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Yarn Fiber: 
75%Acrylic 25% Cotton

Yarn Wash Info: 
Machine wash inside out in cold water, gentle cycle. Lay flat to dry. (But we've found low tumble dry works well too)

name: berroco pattern booklets
description: berroco produces some of the best patterns around. we eagerly await the release of each new season's crop of booklets. always on trend...the berroco design team does a fantastic job. head over to berroco to preview all the patterns and watch fantastic audio slideshows narrated by the designers. (spring 2012 coming soon) don't see a favorite booklet available here? email us and we can order it up just for you. ---------------- Fall 2012 Available PDF copies now; print copies later this summer ----------------- Coming Soon: Download the PDF booklet from last 3 seasons

name: noro silk garden sock yarn
description:
hurray! mr. noro in his infinite wisdom brought back silk garden sock this spring! we're thrilled. it's a lovely silk/wool blend with gorgeous colors. knitting with noro is a no brainer when you need a boost of glorious color. 

a fantastic sock yarn that's perfect for shawls, stoles and garments.  

-----------------------------------
40% lambs wool
25% silk
25% nylon
10% kid mohair
100g 
300m (apx 328yds)

name: noro taiyo & taiyo sock
description: Summer is here but never fear...Noro Taiyo yarns are here! For Noro fans a perfect hot weather yarn alternative to warm wooly yarns. Taiyo comes in two weights: worsted and sock. Composition is a blend of cotton with silk, wool and nylon. Soft, cottony and glorious Noro colorways. The perfect recipe for summertime projects. ----------------------------------------------- Taiyo 40% Cotton, 30% Silk, 15% ea Wool & Nylon 100g (3.5oz) = 200m (218yds) #8-10 US needle Taiyo Sock 50% Cotton, 16% Silk, 17% ea Wool & Nylon 100g (3.5oz) = 420m (459yds) #2-3 US needle ---------------------------------------------------- free patterns! reversible cabled scarf (uses Taiyo) welted cowl (calls for Iro but sub any worsted weight yarn) slip stitch cowl (calls for Kureyon but Taiyo would be great instead) mini knits triangle shawl (Taiyo Sock works perfectly in place of now discontinued Kureyon Sock) cowslip hat and scarf (good for Silk Garden or Taiyo)

name: araucania yarns
description:
Araucania Yarns are inspired by ancient Chilean crafts made from hand painted natural yarns. Founded in 2002 by Michelle Boisier, an architect who has been inspired by her mother, who has always been very keen on wools and the art of dyeing. After seeing her mother's passion for the wool, she decided to professionalize and impregnate the company with her taste for colors and the finesse of the materials.

Michele says: "My mother and I joined our talents and experience to create a company with the goal of introducing this traditional style to the world outside Chile. We are developing a wide range of exclusive variegated colors based entirely on the hand craft process. Each hank is different; its individual beauty emerges as the artisan blends color in the kettle to create several unique shades." 
-----------------------------------------------------------

Lontue: slightly thick-n-thin linen/cotton for light as air garments

    Fiber Content: 50% linen - 50% cotton
    Yardaje: 249,8 yd/228,4 mts.
    Weight: 50 gr./1,76 oz.
    Gauge: 20 sts = 10 cm./4"
    Needle size: 4 mm./6 US.


Ruca: soft rayon yarn with amazing drape and silkiness 

    Fiber Content: 100% viscose (sourced from sugar cane!)
    Yardaje: 263 yd/241 mts.
    Weight: 100 gr./3,52 oz.
    Gauge: 24 sts = 10 cm./4"
    Needle size: 4,5 mm./4-7 US

**new lines coming this fall: 
Panguipulli
Adalien
Nuble

name: berroco elements yarn
description:
Modern and sleek, Elements boasts a unique two-toned effect. A shimmering nylon mesh encloses soft wool, allowing the fibers to peek through and create a gentle halo of color.

FIBER:
51% Wool, 49% Nylon

BALL WEIGHT:
1.75 oz / 50 g

BALL LENGTH:
153 yds / 140 m

KNITTING GAUGE:
4.5 sts = 1" 
18 sts & 25 rows = 4" (10cm)

NEEDLE SIZE:  
9 (US) / 5.5 mm

CROCHET GAUGE:
3.75 sc = 1" 
15 sc & 20 rows = 4" (10cm)

HOOK SIZE:  
9(I) (US) / 5.5 mm

CARE: Hand wash. Lay flat to dry.

name: berroco lodge yarn
description:
Lodge’s mesmerizing color transitions are punctuated with vibrant tweed flecks. The lofty wool blend is spun into a single ply and works up quickly into gorgeous stripes.

FIBER:
47% Wool, 47% Acrylic, 6% Nylon

BALL WEIGHT:
1.75 oz / 50 g

BALL LENGTH:
98 yds / 90 m

KNITTING GAUGE:
3.5 sts = 1" 
14 sts & 20 rows = 4" (10cm)

NEEDLE SIZE:  
10 (US) / 6 mm

CROCHET GAUGE:
3 sc = 1" 
12 sc & 15 rows = 4" (10cm)

HOOK SIZE:  
10(J) (US) / 6 mm

CARE: Hand wash. Lay flat to dry.

name: berroco cirrus yarn
description:
So light it seems to float, Cirrus blends super kid mohair with extra fine merino, locking the fibers into an airy nylon core.

FIBER
42% Superkid Mohair, 40% Nylon, 18% Merino Wool Extra Fine 

HANK WEIGHT:
0.88 oz / 25 g

HANK LENGTH:
114 yds / 104 m

KNITTING GAUGE:
3.75 sts = 1" 
15 sts & 22 rows = 4" (10cm)

NEEDLE SIZE:  
10 (US) / 6 mm

CROCHET GAUGE:
3 sc = 1" 
12 sc & 17 rows = 4" (10cm)

HOOK SIZE:  
10(J) (US) / 6 mm

CARE: Hand wash. Lay flat to dry.

name: berroco boboli & boboli quick yarns
description:
Each shade of Boboli is composed of an enchanting mix of shifting colors. A glimmering wool blend boasting a subtle shine and soft hand, this yarn lends cool-weather projects an air of sophisticated originality. 

Check out big sister Boboli™ Quick. Three strands of our soft and shimmering multicolored wool blend are plied together for a fast and satisfying knit. 
42% Wool, 35% Acrylic, 23% Rayon. 
2.5 sts = 1"  10 sts & 14 rows = 4"

name: building blocks classes
description:
i'm thrilled to finally find the perfect way to teach a "beyond the basics" class series. it's based on a new book by knit instructor michelle hunter, "building blocks" and it's fantastic! 

if you've been wanting to take your knitting to the next level our building blocks series does just that. even if you've got some experience under your belt already you'll benefit from a slew of techniques, tips and working your way through the blocks along with the class.

each block teaches you new elements in a progressive way, to really cement your knitting knowledge. michelle provides loads of videos on her blog (http://knitpurlhunter.com) and tons of useful tips throughout the book. in class we'll work on a block each session (two sessions a month on average). these sessions are aimed to help boost your confidence which is the key element to becoming a better knitter. never again fear the dreaded dropped stitch, or the mysterious language of reading knits and purls. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------

CLASSES:

We meet up bi-weekly to work our way through the Blocks 1-12. Our classes are informal, relaxed, nurturing sessions, with an emphasis placed upon fostering your confidence and knitting skills. Even the most intimidated students emerge as self-assured knitters by the ends of their session. 

We also provide make-up sessions when needed for those weeks when it's impossible to attend a class, to ensure students don't lose momentum. But the class environment is an element of success and many find they really come to enjoy their bi-weekly meet ups and continue even after the course ends. 

So if you've always said..."someday I'll learn to knit better...." this is a perfect class for you.

-----------------------------------------------

UPCOMING SESSIONS:

Session I (Blocks 1-6) begins: Begins late Jul - early Aug 2013 



*If you're anxious to start you can always join in with ongoing classes - just give us a call to arrange*


*If interested let us know. We take schedules into consideration so it's good to let us know what works best for you, weekdays or weekends, and we try to accommodate our customers.*

-----------------------------------------------------

PRICES

pay as you go:
class $10 ea session (book & yarn not included)

or

prepay for the class series:

6 blocks (7 classes) $70 
12 blocks (13 classes) $130 
*15% discount on book & supplies when series purchased*

supplies needed:
Building Blocks books (19.99) avail at shop
6 block blanket: 700-850 yds yarn
12 block afghan: 1400-1700 yds yarn 
needle (circular or straight) to get gauge
stitch markers, cable needle, tapestry needle

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Interested? 

Just call or email us  to be added to signup list or for more info. 

Sample Blocks: We've created several samples in various weights of yarns. Come by the shop to see and decide which yarn you like the best for the project.

name: namaste bags
description:
looking for the perfect bag? look no further. namaste designs with knitters & crafters in mind but appeal to everyone. their bags are durable, stylish, and roomy. be warned: soon you'll be buying multiple bags for every occasion. 


brand new for feb 2012: boardwalk bag, a backpack and in gorgeous espresso brown! latest design: harlowe! 

------------------------------------------

don't see something you'd like? we can easily special order any namaste item. just send us an email with your request.

name: dellaQ organizers
description: needles, circulars, hooks, dpns...oh my! we're always seeking out the "perfect" organizing solutions for the various sundries of our crafts. seek no more! no more boring totes, crumpled brown sacks or ziploc baggies...no siree! dellaQ is now on the scene! dellaQ creates wonderful options in vibrant colors with totally smart options (hello...numbering the slots for us! genius). there's an actual Della, who traveled the world, found luscious fabrics to create hip, fashionable, totally useful products for us crafters. I love that! ------------------------------------------------------------------------ don't hesitate to make special request for any dellaQ product. we can happily place special orders. just fire off an email and we'll get on it. -------------------------------------------------------------------------

name: fun novelty yarns
description:
these super easy, fun yarns make great accent scarves. and i mean easy to knit....so easy even new knitters can master them. with a few hours of effort you'll have a trendy ruffly scarf to add pop to your wardrobe. 

brands we stock: 

rizos, ripple, tinseltown, flourish, flick flack: tape yarn with the boxes along top

triana & triana lux; broadway: mesh yarns with large, open holes

flounce & flounce metallic; onLine job life: mesh style, no holes

park avenue: mohair blend tube you knit with only 3 stitches

berroco's ric rac and lacey

**coming october 2012**
Papillion, Giava, Linie 297 Deco, 
Bizet, Romeo, Matisse, Tinseltown


-------------------------------------

these yarns move fast so if you're looking for particular color just email us and we'll let you know if/when we can restock it.

options.name: onLine job life#107 lilac purples mix

name: knitting pure & simple patterns
description: always true to their name: pure and simple. i love this line of patterns. great basic, easy to follow patterns for staple wardrobe items. one of our core pattern lines for the shop.

name: magazines
description: i admit it. i'm a magazine junkie. interweave makes its easy for me to get my fix. their magazines are always a feast for the eyes and endless potential for indiscriminate casting on (my forte). they publish a whole slew of special issues that are just outstanding. each issue is filled with a range of projects for all levels, fascinating articles and tutorials. each season i pull out my past issues of holiday gifts when choosing presents to make. these are not subscription based so often hard to find....but no longer! i'll post up the current special issues here so too can get your magazine fix. looking for an older interweave magazine or product? we can special order so just send us an email with your request.

name: bee house teapots
description:
bee house are our absolute favorite brand of tea pot by far. each some with it's own mesh infuser. when tea is done, pull it out so you never over brew. makes for a perfect pot of tea. endless color selections so we've highlighted our favorites here. 

just a note: colors and finishes affect the price, that's why some sizes have a ranges of prices. 
---------------------

if you're looking for particular pot or color...we can easily special order with bee house. just email us what you'd like and we'll work on tracking it down for you.

name: serendipiTea teas
description:
serendipiTea is our favorite purveyor of loose leaf teas. high quality, great variety and wonderfully unique flavor blends. we've been fans for decades of this sister-run family tea company. 

we sell the tea in 1oz increments. want 4oz? add to your cart and update cart total to 4. packed in kraft tin tie food safe bags (black tins in photos are display tins - available by special order when purchasing 1lb). 1oz makes about 10 cups of tea. we prefer to sell this way so you can test new flavors out without spending a ton on tea you might not like. if you do...come back for more. :)

our favorite blends listed below. order up as little as an ounce or more. then put the kettle on! 


how to brew perfect cuppa:

*heat up your pot (our favorites are beehouse pots)
*add loose leaf tea to your pot. rule of thumb: 1 tsp for each cup, plus 1 for the pot

*pour freshly boiled water over tea and steep:
2 min max for green teas 
4-5 mins max for black teas
5+ mins for herbal tisanes 

*remove tea leaves and enjoy!

name: cavallini calendars 2014-on sale September
description:
wall calendars measure 13"x19". The vintage images from the Cavallini archives are printed on ivory laid paper stock and are suitable for framing.

planner measures 4x6 inches. Week at a glance layout. Has sections for addresses and notes. Includes Paris, London, and New York City transit maps. 

new for 2013: vintage style measures 9x12 and hangs on wall with small paper, tear-away calendar for each month. 

---------------------------------------------------------------

gorgeous, classic and sought after by cavallini fans year after year.

name: gift certificates
description:
not sure what a loved-one would like? gift certificates make a great gift if you know they're a fan of our shop. 

we'll snail-mail out our gift certificate to the shipping address you specify during checkout. let us know if there's a message you'd like to include to your lucky recipient. we'll add that to the note on the packing slip.
